WINES
CHAMPAGNE
The only wine with any right to the name Champagne is that made from
certain legally specified grapes from the vineyards in well defined sections
of the province of France called Champagne. These vineyards originally
produced still wines that competed with Burgundy, however, in the 17th
century, the discoveries of a benedictine monk, Dom Perignon, led to a
method of producing the sparkling wines known throughout the world
today as champagne. Dom Perignon, who was cellarmaster at the Abbey
of Hautvillers until his death in 1715, became famous for his particularly
the cuvee , and ne is stil nonoured tor nis acnievements.
Nearly two hundred years ago, the old Abbey of Hautvillers and the vine-
yards were taken over by the House of Moët & Chandon. This reputable
firm is now the largest producer of fine champagne.
WHITE BORDEAUX
Graves Rosechâtel is a famous
wine, the secret of which is well
kept by the house of Schröder &
Schyler & Co., the oldest estab-
lished firm in Bordeaux.
Rosechâtel is elegant and dry,
with the typical fruitiness of wine
made mainly from the Sauvignon
grapes, which flourish in the soil
of Graves.
RED BORDEAUX
Château Smith Haut Lafitte's
beautiful vinevard dominates
the Garonne valley and pro-
duces some of the finest red
wine Bordeaux has to offer.
It is a rich and full-bodied wine
with the characteristic Graves
bouquet, and the only wine
with the distinction"Cru Classé
Exceptionnel des Graves".
BURGUNDY
Gevrey-Chambertin is situated
in the northern part of Côte de
Nuits. The wines from this area
are produced from Pinot Noir
grapes and known for their fine
depth of colour, strength and
agreeable bouquet. Gevrey-
Chambertin burgundy is a har-
monious blend of these wines
- rich and yet delicate.
SCANDINAVIAN AQUAVIT
AALBORG AKVAVIT
Danish aquavit - produced in
Aalborg since 1846. This partic-
ular brand with the familiar red
label is exported to all parts of
the world, and it can rightfully
claim a fair share of credit for
the increasing popularity of
aquavit abroad. Crystal clear
Aalborg Akvavit is known for
its distinctive caraway flavour.
LINIE AQUAVIT
Norwegian aquavit - matured in
newly emptied sherry casks, and,
in keeping with an old tradition
Dased on ooservations that the
liquor improves on a sea voyage,
sent to Australla and back again
on Wilhelmsen cargo liners. The
name "Linie" refers to the fact
that this aquavit has crossed the
line (equator twice.
SKANE AKVAVIT
Swedish aquavit from the agri-
cultural southern province of
Skane. This brand has been on
the market since 1931, and it is
now perhaps the most popular
of all Swedish brands. Skane
Akvavit is mildly flavoured
with caraway seeds, coriander
and fennel seeds.

AQUAVIT

of Denmark, Norway and
Sweden, is a clear hard liquor
asted many tropotatoes
and tlavoured with carawav
seeds and other aromatic herbs
and spices.
There are manv brands ol
spiced aquavit on the market,
each with its own particular
characteristics. out there are
also mild and unspiced brands
for those who prefer it plain or
take pleasure in soicing tu
themselves with a few seeds or
a sprig of this and that. The
fetes, sortes or vete

tansy, yellow bedstraw, gale,

can be bought, but the real

Aquavit should always be
consumed with food and goes
eseecta well with nerns,
open sandwiches and other
Scandinavian specialties. It
should also be well chilled and
serveo in sma glasses with
beer alongside to wash it down,
however, customs and opinions
alter wnen i comes to certai
spiced varieties.
By the way, the word "skal"
means oow. Centuries dao.
Scandinavians drank from
